text:
Teaching Point
To iden tify adjectives as w ords w hich tell us m ore about nouns.
Thr ee Sentenc es
1. Ram is a happ y boy.2. This is a big garden.
3. It is a soft cake .
Thr ee Conc epts
1. In sen tence 1, ‘happ y’ tells us mor e about or descr ibes the person ‘boy’.
2. In sen tence 2, ‘big’ tells us mor e about or descr ibes the plac e ‘garden’.
3. In sen tence 3, ‘soft’ tells us mor e about or descr ibes the thing ‘cake ’.
 Words which t ell us mor e about persons , plac es or things ar e called adjec tives.
16Adjectives - I
Describing words are called adjectives.
58Grammar -1

Thr ee Sentenc es
1. I sa w red balloons .
2. Babies ha ve little  ﬁngers .3. I ha ve ﬁve pencils .
Thr ee Conc epts
1. Colour w ords e .g. red, blue , green ar e adjec tives.
2. W ords that tell us about shapes and sizes are all adjectives e.g. little, short, 
round etc.
3. All number w ords e .g. one , four, ﬁve etc are adjec tives.
Adjectives - II
We can describe nouns with the help of colour words, number
words, shapes and sizes.
Grammar -159

EMPO WER
Opposit es
Adjec tives can be learnt with the help of opposit es. Read and learn.
tall shor t lost found
fat thin ﬁrst last
light dark top bott om
black whit e wet dry
clean dirty hot cold
happ y sad sweet sour
thick thin strong weak
young old soft hard
new old beautiful ugly
big small long shor t
60Grammar -1

Fill in the blanks by choosing the correct describing word from the bracket.
1. I t is a  building. (tall, short)  
2. I  am eating a  cake. (creamy, dry)  
3.  e tiger is a  anima l. (strong, weak)  
4. ere are  ships in the sea. (one, many)
5.  D o you see the  snake? (lo ng, short)  
6.  I t is a  butterﬂy. (beautiful, ugly)  
ASSIGNMENT
A. Fill in the blanks with the adjectives given in the box.
beautiful, four, large, wild, huge, hot, blue, good
1. e lion is a _____________ anima l.
2 I saw a _____________ r hino in t he zoo at Delhi.
3. I a te a _____________ p iece of cake at the party.
4. I a lways bathe with _____________ wa ter.
5. She has _____________ e yes.
6.  e king had _____________ s ons.
7.  ere are _____________ r oses in t he garden.
8. Shyam is a _____________ p layer.
Grammar -161

Teaching Point
To iden tify words w hich show relation of one object to the other.
Thr ee Sentenc es
1. The pillo w is on the bed .
 The ca t is under  the bed .
2. The book is  in the drawer.
 The t eacher is standing at the table .
3. The bo y is hiding behind  the bush.
 The g irl is standing in fr ont of the car .
Thr ee Conc epts
1. The w ords “on, under , in, a t, behind , in fr ont of” are called pr epositions .
2. T hey ar e used t o sho w position of one objec t with r elation t o the other 
objec t.
3. They are usually put before a noun or a pronoun.17Prepositions
62 Grammar -1

EMPO WER
1. Where is the dog?
The dog is running af ter Sam.
2. Where are the c ows?
The c ows are in the ﬁeld .
3. Where is the ca t?
The ca t is near the milk .
4. Where is the bo y?
The bo y is jumping o ver the f ence.
5. Where is the w oman?
The w oman is going out fr om the shop .
6. Where is the child .
The child is standing bef ore her fa ther .
ASSIGNMENT
A. Fill in the blanks.
1. Open the books _________ page no. 24.
2. Look _________ the blackboard.
3. The ﬂag is waving _________ the sky .
4. The umbrella is _________ my head.
5. Four comes _________ three.
6. February comes _________ March.
Grammar -163

Teaching Point
To teach that a group of words put in p roper order ma ke a sentence.
Thr ee Sentenc es
1.  I lo ve ﬂo wers. 3. They have delica te wings . 2. Butt erﬂies sit on the ﬂowers.
Thr ee Conc epts
1. A sen tence is a g roup of w ords tha t makes c omplet e sense .
2. A sen tence beg ins with a capital lett er and ends in a full st op.
3. Every sen tence should ha ve one v erb e.g. love, sit and ha ve.
18The Sentence
EMPO WER
1. He goes to school by bus.
2. Monkeys jump from  branch to branch.
3. The children sing a song.
4. The postman brings our letters.
5. Those are huge and old trees.A group of words that make complete sense is called a sentence.
64Grammar -1

Rewrite the sentences using capital letters and full stops.
 1. i have two dogs
  
 2. the sun rises in the east
  
 3. the children are playing ball
  
 4. riya is six years old
  
 5. he is going to Delhi
  
 6. it was a big bear
  
 7. we pray in a temple
  
 8. there are clouds in the sky
  
ASSIGNMENT
Grammar -165
